page.title: 07BARNACK HILLS AND HOLES
page.content: On Thursday the 11th of July we went to the Hills and Holes. We started off where the quarry used to be.The quarry was last used in 1450. Now that stone is under the Barnack Drift. There are sheep,lots of gates and stiles and lots of trees and hawthorn shrubs. Soon they will have to remove some to make some more room for the flowers to grow. Many species have survived here. Mr Lewin looks after a part of the hills and holes. He showed us some of the flowers.In half an hour we found:- Hair Bell,Yellow Bed Straw, Rock Rose,Purple Clover,Pyramid Orchid Birds Foot Trefoil,Kidney Vetch,Totter Grass, Ribb Plantain, Horey Plantain, Drop Wort,Jack Goes To Bed At Noon, Wild Parsnip,Common Vetch,Bee orchid. There were lots of other flowers but we didnt have time to see them.
